properties.description: Posted by BpeaceNew York On the morning of september 11, 2001 the world trade center in New York City was attacked. It was a horrible day for the people of America and even more so for the people of New York. It is a day we will never forget. Teams of hijackers hijacked 4 U.S. airliners. Two of these jets were successfully crashed into the world trade canter killing many people. A third airliner was then crashed into the pentagon. The 4th was crashed into a field in Pennsylvania from an attempt of the passengers trying to overthrow the hijackers. A total of 2,974 were killed from these attacks.

properties.name: D day
properties.description: Posted by BpeaceNormandy, France On June 6, 1944, 160,000 allied troops launched a land invasion on the beaches of Normandy. It was a 50 mile stretch of beach heavily guarded by the French. They wanted to defeat Nazi, Germany. Eisenhower stated,"we will accept nothing less than full victory." 5,000 Ships and 13,000 aircrafts supported the D-Day invasion. All though many were lost, they were successfull in invading the beaches of Normandy.

properties.name: Declaration of Independence
properties.description: Posted by BpeaceIndependence Hall Philadelphia The declaration of independence was signed in Independence Hall of Philadelphia. This was the doings of the Second Continental Congress. It was adopted on July 4, 1776. It Declared freedom and independence for the 13 colonies of N. America. Thomas Jefferson, John Adams, and Benjamin Franklin were the Authors. It demanded total seperation from the state of Great Britain. This document is now kept at the National Archives and Records Administration.

properties.name: Grand Canyon National Park
properties.description: Posted by BpeaceÂ grand canyon national park The Grand Canyon is located in the state of Arizona. It is a steep crevice or gorge believed to be carved by the Colorado river. It is in the Grand Canyon National Park which is one of the US\'s first national parks. It is 277 miles long and the width ranges from 4 to 18 miles. President Roosevelt played a major role in the preservation of the Grand Canyon. He also visited the area frequently to hunt or just enjoy the scenery.

properties.name: Great wall of China
properties.description: Posted by Bpeacegreat wall of china The Great wall of China was built over 2000 years ago. It was built by Qin Shi Huangdi, the first emperor of China during the Qin Dynasty. The wall is called "Wan-Li Qang-Qeng" which means 10,000-Li Long Wall in Chinese. Its about 5000 km. It is one of the largest building projects to ever be completed. It is made of masonry, rocks and packed-earth. It is up to 30 ft thick and up to 25 feet tall.

properties.name: Pearl Harbor
properties.description: Posted by BpeacePearl Harboor On December 7, 1941, Pearl Harbor was raided and bombed. This attack was launched by the Japanese Navy on a U.S. Naval base in Hawaii. It all happened unexpectedly and early on a sunday morning. It was meant to be a surprise attack and it definately took us by surprise. It was intended by Japan too take out the U.S. pacific fleet. This event however just inclined the U.S. to enter into WW2. It was an aerial attack in which japan sent 353 aircrafts. 2,388 U.S. were killed and 1,178 were wounded.

properties.name: Pilgrims establish Plymouth
properties.description: Posted by Bpeace Plymouth Colony is America\'s first permanent Puritan settlement. It was established in the December of 1620. The pilgrims left England looking for religious freedom and simply looking for a new place to start life. They set sail on Sept. 16 on the Mayflower. It sailed with 102 passengers spending 65 days on the water. The Pilgrims landed at the site of Plymouth, Mass., on Dec. 26, 1620.

properties.name: Ponce de Leon
properties.description: Posted by Bpeace Ponce de Leon with his own cause and at his own expense began his voyage in 1513. He was in high hopes of discovery. He was in hopes of discovery and conquest. Some say he was in search of the fountain of youth. On April 2, he landed on the east coast of what we now call Florida. It is still disputed over exactly where he landed. He discovered the land and claimed it Spain\'s. He named it La Florida meaning flowery.

properties.name: Saddam Hussein
properties.description: Posted by Bpeaceiraq Saddam Hussein was once the president of Iraq. He was in control July 16, 1979, until April 9, 2003. He was taken away as leader during the 2003 invasion of Iraq by U.S. forces. The reasons for the invasion were to find and disarm any weapons of MD, to end Saddam Hussein\'s support for terrorism, and to free the Iraqi people. This invasion began the war in iraq however Saddam was was executed Dec 30, 2006.

properties.name: St. Augustine
properties.description: Posted by BpeaceSt. Augustine St. Augustine is the oldest city ever recorded in the United States of America. It is considered the oldest and longest lasting settlement in the North American Continent. It was established September 8, 1565 by Pedro Menendez de Aviles for the King of Spain, Philip II. This historical city overcame many obstacles and problems. It got through storms and attacks and just kept on going. It is now visited every day by many people and is a major tourist interest.
